message: System is configured for REAL PLC hardware communication via Modbus TCP/IP to 169.254.123.6:502, not simulation mode
Found write parameter flow: System requires write_modbus_address in database for each writable parameter. Lines 581-586 in real_plc.py show writes fail when this address is missing.

data.key_code: if address is None: logger.error(...missing write_modbus_address) return False

message: KEY DIFFERENCE: Simulation PLC ignores write_modbus_address completely - writes always succeed (line 203-223). Real PLC requires write_modbus_address and fails if missing (line 581-586).

CONFIRMED: System IS using real PLC hardware via Modbus TCP/IP. All power_on parameters have proper write_modbus_address configured. The write functionality works through pymodbus client (write_coil, write_registers) to physical hardware at 169.254.123.6:502.
